alert.note: Alert for Coke; Crockett; Irion; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 12:17AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coke, Sterling, central Tom Green, northeastern Crockett and Irion Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1213 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from Sterling City to Big Lake to Iraan, moving southeast at 30 mph. These storms will move into Robert Lee and and Mertzon around 1 AM, San Angelo and Ozona around 2 AM. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are likely and will likely produce street flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Robert Lee, Sterling City, Mertzon, Christoval, Ozona, Bronte, Barnhart, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Grape Creek, Sanco, Knickerbocker, Arden, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Lake Nasworthy, Tankersley, San Angelo State Park, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Water Valley and Sherwood. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 366 and 370. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Crockett; Irion; Sterling; Tom Green
